author: parithosh
content:
We'd still perform a few more tests on devnet-2, but in general we're waiting on launching devnet-3 for the next round of testing. 

The specs doc can be found here: https://notes.ethereum.org/@ethpandaops/pectra-devnet-3

Open topics: 
- 7702 changes, also flagged here: https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/718596092828057631/1272489434134085743
- Execution spec tests release needed, cc <@892053833121923094> <@755913785620824175> 
- Builder spec updates, unsure who's owning this right now, cc <@539495253418180618> <@694014391288332358>

As always, let me or Barnabas know if there's a missing PR or you see outdated information.

author: tersec
content: ethereumjs missing on all pairs?

author: tersec
content: also dora back to showing very little history on proposer name filtering

author: barnabasbusa
content:
Dora is re-indexing with a new db. cc <@808969530608451584>. Might take a few hours before all epoch are done. 

ethjs is expected to have issues with block proposals as per <@792822129019584562> said last week on acd. We plan to have ethjs around to follow the chain in the future, and rely less on their block proposals

author: pk910
content:
should be fixed now üôÇ
but as barnabas said, the db is not complete yet, so don't rely on historical data yet. should be ready by tomorrow

author: g11tech
content: correct, if network load is low, ethjs should also be proposing else its always in a mode of catchup unless we plan to plug a rust evm in future

author: marioevz
content: 7702 tests are ready for devnet-3, we just need a transition tool to fill them, it could be from any client, whichever is ready first üëç

author: jochembrouwer
content: I am working on this right now, will report when I think it's done üôÇ

author: jochembrouwer
content: In the tests you have written, if a evm opcode hits a delegated account, is then the account it is delegated to also added to the warm addresses?

author: marioevz
content: It should already be in the warm addresses list, the moment it's read from the delegated accounts list

author: jochembrouwer
content: Ah no, I mean when evm hits an `extcodesize` for instance

author: marioevz
content: so `extcodesize` to the code address that the account was delageted to? yes it's cold until `extcodesize`

author: marioevz
content: Might be worth mentioning that the only time when the code account could be warm is if the address is in the access list: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/blob/4aaf7ed3b219caba6326a3ac39af022e5a82160b/tests/prague/eip7702_set_code_tx/test_gas.py#L628-L629

author: jameshe5018
content: there's some bugs with prysm's committee logic with EIP7549 changes, perhaps that's what's creating some issues. still working through it.

author: .paulharris
content: what fork is that running? We did enable v3 block production by default - can turn it off with (`--Xblock-v3-enabled=false`) and see if that improves things?

author: somnergy
content: `pectra-devnet-2` canonical. Almost all slots are missed by Teku-Erigon pair recently, is that V3 block production a recent change?

author: .paulharris
content: yes it was using v2 until a few days ago so we might revert that, but also i need to check the release...

author: .paulharris
content: does at least look like the release is correct just closing that off - so we'll chase down why v3 appears to be not happy for electra - ta for heads up <@976542403269910539>

author: .paulharris
content:
other teku combos are working so its possibly not related to v3 unless theres different instances running, we'll have to do more digging. I noticed locally it seems to run happily in kurtosis for electra, so that kind of blows the 'v3 block production theory' up just fyi.
It looks like erigon occasionally missing with prysm too. Will see if we can replicate misses I guess.
